High-pressure oxygen-induced bulk superconductivity in 1222 structure Tl-Pb-Sr-
Eu(Ce)-Cu-O

text.front:
High-pressure oxygen-induced bulk superconductivity
in 1222 structure
I
TI-Pb-Sr-Eu(Ce)-Cu-0
Z. lqbal
Allied-Signal Inc., Research and Technology, Morrfsfown, New Jersey 07962
A. P. B. Sinha and D. E. Morris
Morris Research Inc., Berkeley, Califbrnid '94704
J. C. Barry and G. J. Auchterlonie
Electron Microscope Center, University of Queens&d, Brisbane, Australia
B. L. Ramakrishna
Department of Chemistry, Arizona State University, Tempe. Arizona 85287
(Received 4 March 1991; accepted for publication 4 May 1991)
A primarily single phase compound of composition (T1c.sPbc.s ) Srz ( Euz _ &!e,) Cua09 (where
x ranges from (0.1 to 0.17) has been synthesized in the so-called 1222 structure. Bulk
superconductivity near 40 K is induced via oxygen doping in 100 bar of oxygen at 550 "C!. The
material has been structurally characterized by diffraction and high-resolution lattice
imaging techniques. The lattice images reveal the presence of some intergrowths of a 1212
structure nonsuperconducting (Tle,Pb&Sr2EuCu207
phase in the bulk 1222
structure of the parent compound and indications of periodicity that suggest the possible
existence of a new, composite structure 2434 phase.
text.body:
INTRODUCTION
Recently Bi-and Tl-based compounds of composition
(Bi or Tl),(Sr or Ba)z(Ln,L,Ce,)C.u2010
(where Ln is
Sm, Eu, or Gd) have been successfully synthesized by
Tokura et al.' In these so-called 2222~structure cuprates,
adjacent CuO, layers are separated by a Lnz _ ,Ce,o2 flu-
orite block and are alternately offset in the a direction. The
Bi-based compounds display bulk superconductivity after
annealing in 80 bar O2 at 550-600 "C for 10 h. The transi-
tion temperature initially reported was about 25 K but this
has been recently improved to 40 K by optimizing 'the
synthesis and annealing conditions.2 Superconductivity has
so far not been found under these conditions in the Tl-s
based 2222 compound,' and in the Tl-0 monolayer Tl-Ba-
Ln(Ce)-Cu-0
1222 compound, which has been synthe-
sized by Martin et al3
The discovery of superconductivity in the Tl-Sr-Ca-
Cu-0 system with T, at 20 K (Ref. 4) and its optimization
via Ce doping to a bulk T, of 65 K (Ref. 5), and the
discovery
of
superconductivity
in
isostructural
(Tlo,SPbO.s)Sr&!aCuzO, with a Tc of 85 K (Ref. 6) [tihich
has now been raised to 105 K (Ref. 7) by Y doping at the
Ca sites], suggested that the synthesis of the related com-
pounds of composition ( Tle,Pbc.5) Sr2( Ln, _ &e;)C!u209
having the 1222 structure may be possible. Phases of for-
mula (Tli -,Pb,) (Sri -,LaJ2(Lnl
-yCe )2CuZ09 in the
1222 structure were indeed synthesized,'but found to be
nonsuperconducting. In this paper we report the synthesis,
in essentially single phase form, of a new compound of
composition ( TlcsPbc.s) SrZ( Eu, _ ,Ce,) CuZ09 having the
1222 structure [abbreviated here as (Tl,Pb)-12221, and its
doping under high 0, pressure to give a bulk superconduc-
tor with a T, onset near 40 K. This i.s the, first report, to our
knowledge, of superconductivity
in the (Tl,Pb)-1222
structure cuprates; superconductivity at 25 K has however
been reported by Maeda et al.' in a (Pb,Cu)-1222 cuprate
of composition (Pb,Cu) ( Sr,Eu)Z( Eu,Ce)2Cu20Z. The gen-
eral features of the structure and microstructure of the
(Tl,Pb)-1222 compound have also been determined. by
powder x-ray dilIraction, selected area electron diffraction,
and high-resolution lattice imaging.
SYNTHESlS
The best specimens of (Tl,Pb)-1222 were obtained
with a-nominal content of Ce in the above-given formula of
x = 0.2: The samples were prepared in two steps. A matrix
of nominal composition Sr2( Euc.&!ect ) &uZO, was first
prepared from a well-ground precursor mixture of SrO,
EuzO3, Ce&, and CuO, which was fired in air at 950 "C! for
16 h. The matrix powder was then mixed with a stoichio-
metric amount of PbO and B 10% excess by weight of
T1203, followed by pelletization. The pellet was placedin-
sidea gold tube, which was closed by crimping on one side
and by spot welding on the other side. The gold tube was
pushed into a furnace at 925 "C under flowing O2 and held
at this temperature for 6 h. At the end of this period the
furnace was opened and the sample allowed to cool rapidly
(down to 30 "C in about 30 min) under flowing OF
RESULTS AND DISCUSSION
The, powder x-ray (Ct.&a: radiation) diffraction pat-
tern (measured using a Rigaku diffractometer) of the as-
prepared material is shown in Fig. 1. Except for unreacted
CeOZ and a small amount of an impurity phase (see dis-
cussion below) indicated by crosses in Fig. 1, the diffrac-
tion lines can be indexed to the same structure (tetra-

Selected area electron diffraction patterns yielded av-

A representative high resolution lattice image obtained us-
ing a JEOL 4000 FX electron microscope is shown in Fig.
2 together with the corresponding electron diffraction pat-
FIG. 2. [X0] lattice image of a Tle5PbO&Eu2 -xCexCuz09 (x(0.1 to
0.17) microcrystal. Inset on the left shows the corresponding selected
area diffraction pattern. Inset at the center shows a computer simulated
image.
FIG. 1. Powder x-ray diffraction (CIA&)
of a typical as-synthesized sample of
TlasPbO.sSr,Euz _ .$e,Cu,O, (x(0.1 to

tern and image simulation. The image is in the [loo] pro-
jection and shoivs the layer sequence of the structure. Us;

a simulated image in good agreement with the structure is
obtained (inset, Fig. 2). The structure proposed for the
(Tl,Pb)-1222 compound is shown in Fig. 3. An important
feature of the structure is a MiO, fluorite block (where M'
in our sample is Eu doped by Ce) which separates the

text.body:
CuO? layers of the structure. As evident from the lattice
6
image, the Cu atoms in consecutive Cu02 layers down the
c axis are offset in the a direction by (a + b)/2 (where a
and b are 2-dimensional unit cell vectors for the pseudo-
tetragonal Cu02 sheet). The charge reservoir layer is a
single Tl-0 plane in which half the Tl ions are replaced by
Pb ions. Because of the strongly oxidizing synthesis condi-
tions used, the oxidation states of Tl and Pb are likely to be
+ 3 and + 4, respectively. An oxidation state of + 4 has
been determined for Pb in the 77 K "12 13" superconduc-
tor of composition Pbo.sSrBal.zYo.,Cao.3CU307 + 6 (Ref.
10) prepared under similar conditions. In addition, the
lattice images from some of the microcrystals show inter-
growths of the single M' layer (Tl,Pb)-1212 phase of com-
position (TlcSPbo.JSr,EuCuzO-/. In some of the crystal-
lites the (TI,Pb)-1212 intergrowths display some degree of
periodicity, indicating the possible existence of a new com-
posite phase; namely, a (TI,Pb)-2434 compound consisting
of an alternating fluorite block and single M' layer primi-
tive unit cell. In the YBa,Cu,Os (Y-124) compound, for
example, similar periodic intergrowths of the YBa@@7
(Y-123)
phase can occur to give a composite
Y2Ba4Cu701s (Y-247) phase.' * Preliminary x-ray diffrac-
tion data indicate the formation of a (semiconducting)
(Tl,Pb)-2434 compound from a stoichiometric mixture of
the oxides under similar conditions as described above.
Results of doping experiments and detailed characteriza-
tion of this phase will be published elsewhere. In addition
to (Tl,Pb)-1212 intergrowths, some isolated crystallites of
the (Tl,Pb)-12 12 phase were also detected. X-ray reflec-
tions associated with an impurity phase in Fig. 1 are there-
fore likely to be due to this compound. This was also
confirmed
by
synthesizing
nearly
pure
(Tlc5Pb0.5)Sr2EuCuz07, which was found to be nonsuper-
conducting down to 4 K in the as-prepared form as well as
on 6-bar O2 annealing.
Analytical transmission electron microscopy using en-
ergy dispersive spectroscopy with an intrinsic germanium
high-angle x-ray detector was used to determine the atomic
compositions of a series of crystallites from various prep-
arations. Most of the crystallites corresponded to a
Tl(Pb)-Sr-Eu-Cu
1222 composition in which the Tl:Pb ra-
tio is 1:l. Ce was barely detectable in 80% of the crystal-
lites, consistent with the observation of unreacted crystal-
line Ce02 in the product. However, 20% of the grains did
contain Ce with x near 0.17.
Four-probe dc resistance measurements of the as-pre-
pared (Tl,Pb)-1222 product shows semiconducting behav-
ior (Fig. 4) consistent with the observations of Tokura et
al. in Tl-2222 and Mochiku et al8 in related compounds.
However, a sample annealed at 550 "C for 24 h under 6
bars of O2 in a high pressure bomb indicates reduced semi-
conducting behavior and a resistance drop with an onset
near 22 K, as evident from Fig. 41 Zero-field-cooled
SQUID magnetic susceptibility data shown in Fig. 5 rep-
resent results for the 6-bar 02-annealed sample and a 100-
bar 02-annealed sample processed for 5 h at 550 "C! in a
commercial high-pressure O2 furnace." Magnetic suscep-
tibility data for an as-prepared sample shows no indication

of diamagnetism consistent with the resistivity data. The
6-bar O,-annealed sample shows an approximately 3%-
volume diamagnetic fraction with diamagnetic onset near
20 K, consistent with the observed drop in resistance. The
lOO-bar.02-annealed sample clearly shows an enhancement
of the diamagnetic volume fraction to nearly 20% and an
increase of the diamagnetic onset T, to near 40 K. Field-
cooled Meissner fractions in this and similarly prepared
samples were found to be greater than 10% by volume,
indicating the occurrence of bulk superconductivity. How-
ever, on annealing the sample under 200 bars of O2 at
550 "C! for 10 h, the diamagnetic fraction is sizably re-
duced. No changes are observed in the x-ray diffraction
patterns of the high 02-pressure annealed samples of
(Tl,Pb)-1222 indicating that doping affects only the oxy-
gen sublattice. Samples annealed at 100 bars of O2 show
Temperature
(K)

perature for: (A) 6-bars 02-annealed sample and (B) lCO-bar
Oz-annealed sample of Tle,Pbo.,Sr2Eu2 _ ,CexCu209 (x(0.1 to 0.17).

text.body:
decreased resistance and sizable drops near T,, but zero
resistance down to -12 K (the limit of our resistance
data) was not observed, although large Meissner fractions
were found in these samples. In addition, the temperature
dependence of the resistance remained weakly semicon-
ducting, suggesting that the grain boundary regions are not
optimally doped in the ceramic samples.
The oxygen content of the Tl-based cuprates cannot be
determined either by iodometric titration or thermogravi-
metric methods. Also, neutron diffraction experiments are
complicated by strongly neutron absorbing rare earth ele-
ments in the (Tl,Pb)-1222 compounds. Nevertheless, the
oxygen content can be qualitatively estimated on the basis
of the expected oxidation state of the constituent ions; thus,
for (T10.sPbo.5)SrzCaCuzO~, the 0 content is estimated to
be 6.75, assuming that Pb is + 4 and Cu is + 2. In order
to achieve the oxygen level of 7 for the layered oxygen-
deficient perovskite 1212 structure, the compound has to
be oxygen doped to form Cu + 3, which leads to supercon-
ductivity when the doping reaches a value near the semi-
conductor-to-metal transition phase boundary. The results
of Barry et al6 for (T1,,5Pbo.5)Sr2CaCu207 have shown
that this doping level is achieved at l-bar O2 to give a T,
near 85 K. However, some samples showed a resistance
drop at 105 K, which, in the light of the more recent
results on electron doping via Y + 3 substitution at the
Ca + ' sites,7 sugg ests that the as-synthesized samples were
somewhat overdoped, and that an optimally doped sample
would have a T, near 105 K. In the case of
(Tlo.sPbo.s)SrzEuz _ XCe,Cu209 similar charge counting
(neglecting Ce) yields an 0 content of 8.75, whereas for
(TlesPbo,s)SrZEuCu207, the 0 content is 7.25. Both these
compounds are semiconducting in the as-prepared (l-bar-
0,) state-the (Tl,Pb)-1222 compound appears to remain
hole deficient under conditions of ambient pressure oxygen
synthesis, whereas ( Tlo.sPbo.s) Sr2EuCu207 is overdoped
under these circumstances. The hole deficiency is removed
in the (Tl,Pb) -1222 compound by high pressure (to about
loo-bar-02) oxygen annealing, but doping with oxygen at
interstitial sites occurs at pressures above 200-bar-O2 lead-
ing to a decrease in the superconducting volume fraction.
Note that the T, of 40 K for (Tl,Pb)-1222, Bi-2222, and
(Pb,Cu)-1222 corresponds to that of a typical single
CuOZ
layer
cuprate
such
as the
T-structure
La2 _ ,Sr,CuO$ compound. This suggests that in the 1222
and 2222 cuprates the CuOZ sheets are effectively indepen-
dent since they are separated by Mao, fluorite blocks.
